III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has been in the hospital 3 times within a month. The most
recent visit was regarding the youth picking at wounds made by
their fingernails. Youth A was discharged back to the facility with
1:1 supervision. Youth A was somehow able to obtain glass and
cut their arm deeply, requiring sutures.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 07/22/2024 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
Youth A was interviewed at the hospital on 07/23/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A initially did not want
to answer any questions. After a few minutes, Youth A agreed to
answer questions. Youth A reported he cut his arms with a piece
of brown glass that he found on the floor in his room. He said he
covered his arms with the blanket, so the staff did not see that he
was cutting himself. After he cut his arms, he threw the piece of
glass in the toilet. Youth A said there was a staff member sitting
outside his door, but he hid his arms under the blanket, so the
staff member could not see what he was doing. Youth A was
observed to have two cuts stitched, several scars and scratches
with scabs on his left arm.
Doctor was interviewed at the hospital on 07/23/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Doctor reported Youth A
said he used a piece a glass to cut his arms. She said Youth A
has been observed picking and using his fingers to cut and
remove the sutures. She said the cuts on Youth A’s arms could
have been caused by Youth A’s fingernails. She did not say the
cuts could have been caused by the glass but said Youth A
reported he used a piece of glass.
JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 07/24/2024. JJ
Worker reported Youth A is upset because of the criminal charges
2

he is facing and therefore is self-harming. She reported no
concerns regarding the facility and staff supervision.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 07/24/2024 and
reported no additional information.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 07/29/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Administrator reported
Youth A had been hospitalized the evening of 7/19/2024 for self-
harming and came back to the facility at around 1:00 AM on
07/20/2024. Youth A was placed on suicide watch and a staff
member was sitting outside Youth A's room. Administrator
reported a room search was completed before Youth A was
placed in the room and there was nothing found in the room. A
room was search was completed after Youth A was taken to the
hospital and there was nothing found in the room. Youth A has
been hospitalized several times due to Youth A removing stitches
and using his fingers to self-harm.
Manager was interviewed at the facility on 07/29/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Manager reported Youth A
was placed on suicide watch on 07/20/2024 after returning from
the hospital at 1:40 am. She said Staff 1 was assigned to
supervise Youth A and was sitting outside the bedroom. She said
when a youth is placed on suicide watch, they are only permitted
to have a mattress and blanket. A room search is conducted
before the youth is placed in the room. Manager said Youth A
likes being in the hospital because he is able to play video games,
and is able to eat anything he wants, and gets a lot of attention. A
room search was completed after Youth A went to the hospital
and there was nothing found in the room. Manager suspected
Youth A used his fingers because that’s what he had done the day
before.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 07/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported she was
working on 07/20/2024 and did supervise Youth A during Staff 1’s
break. She was informed that Youth A had self-harmed and was
going to be transported to the nurse’s office. She observed Youth
A to have cuts on his arms. She said staff had cleaned the cuts
and were waiting for transport to take Youth A to the nurse office.
She observed only a mattress and blanket in the room. She did
not see any glass in the room. Staff 2 reported rooms are always
searched before a youth is placed. Staff will search around the
windows, light fixture, sink, toilet, and desk.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 07/29/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported she was
working on 07/20/2024 and covered for Staff 1 who was
supervising Youth A during a bathroom break. She was informed
that Youth A had self-harmed, and Staff 1 was waiting on
transport to take Youth A to the nurse office. Staff 3 denied seeing
anything in Youth A’s room besides the mattress and blanket.
Staff 4 was interviewed at the facility on 07/31/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 reported she
transported Youth A to the hospital on 07/20/2024. Youth A told
her he used a piece of glass to self-harm and that he had the
glass hidden. He would not tell her where he found the glass or
where he had this hidden. Staff 4 has supervised Youth A while at
the hospital and at the facility and has observed Youth A to use
his fingers to open old wounds and self-harm. Staff 4 was
assigned to supervise Youth A on 07/19/2024 and he had used
his fingernails to self-harm by opening an old wound making the
wound bigger.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed at the facility on 07/31/2024, at the
facility in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1
reported he attended to Youth A on 07/20/2024 due to self-
harming. Youth A was encouraged not to use his fingers to open
and dig into the cuts on his arm. Supervisor 1 denied finding or
witnessing Youth A using a piece of glass to self-harm. Youth A
was on 1:1 supervision due to self-harming. Staff 1 was assigned
to supervise Youth A. Supervisor 1 said Youth A’s room had been
searched prior to Youth A being placed in the room. He said there
was nothing found in the room before or after Youth A was taken
to the hospital. He witnessed Youth A using his fingers to dig into
the wounds on his arm.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 07/31/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 was assigned to
supervise Youth A on 07/20/2024. Youth A was placed in the
suicide room. She talked to him before he went to sleep and
encouraged him not to self-harm, because he was using his
fingers to scratch his arm. She sat outside Youth A’s room and
monitored him throughout her shift. Youth A went to sleep around
3:00 am. Later in the evening, she witnessed Youth A again
digging at his old wounds with his fingernails. She tried talking to
him and encouraged him not to self-harm, but he continued
digging at his wounds. He refused to stop, so she immediately
called the Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 came and tried to encourage
Youth A to stop digging into the cuts on his arm. She said she saw
4

him using his nails to make the cuts. She said they cleaned up the
cuts and waited for Youth A to be transported to the nurse’s office.
Staff 1 denied seeing Youth A use a piece of glass to self-harm.
She did not see any glass or sharp items in the room.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed at the facility on 07/31/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor 2 completed the
room check on 07/20/2024 before Youth A was placed in the
suicide room. He searched the window, light fixture, under the
mattress, around the sink, toilet, and desk. He denied there was
any glass or other objects on the floor. Supervisor 2 is not aware
of any brown glass in the facility. He reported all staff members
are trained on room searches. Weekly meetings are held with staff
and incident reports are reviewed to ensure staff are aware of
what is going on with the youths.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on 07/29/2024 in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. The suicide room was observed to have a
light fixture attached to the wall that is made out of metal and is
placed at an angle, a small glass block window, a desk that is
made out of cement and is attached to the wall, and toilet and sink
attached to the wall. Manager demonstrated how staff conduct a
room search by running their hands above the light fixture, around
the crease in between the wall around the window area, around
the sink, and toilet.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage reviewed at the facility on 07/29/2024. Video date
07/20/2024 at approximately 1:40 am. Youth A is being escorted
to the suicide observation room. (video does not have audio). Staff
1 is observed placing a desk and chair outside the suicide room
the chair is facing the bedroom. The camera does not preview into
the bedroom, but the video footage shows that Staff 1 was sitting
outside the bedroom throughout the night.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident dated 07/14/2024, written by Manager. Youth A
was sent to the hospital for evaluation of the left arm wound
as he continues to dig in the wound.
• Incident report dated 07/19/2024, written by Supervisor 2
Youth A removed previous wound bandages from his left
arm, reopening the wound. Youth A was sent to the
hospital. Youth A returned to the facility on 07/20/2024 at
1:40 AM.
5

• Incident report dated 07/20/2024, written by Supervisor 2.
Youth A removed the bandages from his left arm reopening
the wound again. Youth A was examined by the nurse and
sent back to the hospital. Youth A was admitted to the
hospital and remains on suicide precaution.
• Facility’s room search checklist: Staff must check the
window seal, toilet, sink, room door, mattress, desk, light
fixture.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the rule based on
interviews conducted with doctor, staff and youths. There is
insufficient evidence that Youth A wasn’t supervised and used a
piece of glass to cut his arm. There was no glass found in the
room.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
